intro: Microlicia canastrensis var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and ixora plants. The species is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers.
